conversations.description: Sales rep asks LeadCraft to fetch a prospect’s LinkedIn profile and summarize recent activity before drafting an email.
User requests the latest news about a target company and wants the top three headlines turned into talking points for outreach.
A manager asks LeadCraft to pull CRM interaction history for a contact and highlight any previous objections.
User asks for a three‑step cold‑email sequence that weaves together LinkedIn insights, company news, and CRM notes.
Salesperson wants the first email scheduled for tomorrow morning at 9 AM with a personalized subject line.
User requests a five‑email cadence because the prospect is a high‑value target with a long sales cycle.
LeadCraft is asked to generate a follow‑up email that references a recent product launch the prospect’s company announced.
User wants to log the newly created email sequence back to the CRM record and verify the JSON payload.
Sales rep asks for a brief summary of the prospect’s career changes over the past two years from LinkedIn.
User requests an email draft that acknowledges a recent award the prospect’s company received.
LeadCraft pulls LinkedIn activity to find a common interest (e.g., marathon training) to personalize an ice‑breaker.
User wants to see a side‑by‑side comparison of two prospects’ LinkedIn headlines to tailor messaging.
Sales manager asks LeadCraft to generate a sequence that includes a video demo link for prospects in SaaS.
User requests scheduling of a reminder email two days after the initial outreach if no reply is received.
LeadCraft pulls recent funding news for a startup and builds an email that references the new capital.
User asks for an email that subtly references a mutual connection found on the prospect’s LinkedIn.
Sales rep wants a concise email subject line that reflects the prospect’s role as VP of Marketing.
User asks LeadCraft to suggest a best‑time‑to‑send cadence based on the prospect’s timezone from LinkedIn.
LeadCraft generates a sequence that adapts tone for a C‑level executive versus a mid‑level manager.
User requests a summary of the last three calls logged in the CRM before drafting a re‑engagement email.
Salesperson asks LeadCraft to pull LinkedIn recommendations to add social proof to the email body.
User wants a sequence that incorporates a case‑study relevant to the prospect’s industry.
LeadCraft creates a holiday‑themed outreach email that still references recent company news.
User asks to schedule the second email in the sequence exactly three business days after the first.
Sales manager requests a dashboard view of all scheduled emails for a team of five reps.
LeadCraft fetches a prospect’s recent LinkedIn article and suggests quoting a line in the email.
User asks for a version of the email sequence translated into Spanish for a Latin American prospect.
Sales rep wants to add a personalized GIF link based on the prospect’s recent hobby found on LinkedIn.
User requests a concise email that addresses a pricing objection noted in the CRM notes.
LeadCraft generates a “breakup” email for a prospect who hasn’t responded after three touches.
User asks for a quick A/B test suggestion for subject lines based on recent open‑rate trends.
Salesperson wants to attach a PDF brochure to the third email and have LeadCraft embed the download link.
User requests a summary of quarterly earnings news for the prospect’s company to add relevance.
LeadCraft pulls LinkedIn “Skill Endorsements” to highlight the prospect’s expertise in the email.
User asks for a warm‑intro email after a recent conference where the prospect was a speaker.
Sales rep wants a concise follow‑up after a demo call, referencing specific product features discussed.
LeadCraft suggests a personalized LinkedIn connection request message before sending the email.
User asks LeadCraft to generate a short email reminder for a scheduled call happening in two days.
Sales manager wants to bulk‑generate sequences for a list of 20 prospects, each with unique personalization.
User requests an email sequence that includes a link to a relevant industry webinar.
LeadCraft creates a subject line that incorporates a trending industry buzzword from recent news.
Sales rep asks for a “quick win” email that references a recent product feature rollout by the prospect’s company.
User wants LeadCraft to log a note in the CRM stating that the email sequence was sent and scheduled.
LeadCraft pulls a prospect’s alma mater from LinkedIn to add a friendly alumni reference.
User requests a polite “no‑reply” email after a prospect indicates they are not interested.
Salesperson wants a version of the email that emphasizes ROI calculations for the prospect’s role.
LeadCraft generates a sequence that alternates between plain‑text and HTML formatted emails.
User asks to schedule a follow‑up call reminder email for one week after the final outreach email.
Sales manager requests a summary report of open and click metrics for the last month’s sequences.
LeadCraft pulls a recent press release about a partnership the prospect’s company entered and weaves it into the email.
User wants a concise email that asks for a 15‑minute discovery call after a positive LinkedIn interaction.
Sales rep asks LeadCraft to recommend a personalized closing line based on the prospect’s communication style.
User requests a sequence that includes an invitation to a private Slack community for industry peers.
LeadCraft creates a reminder email that includes a calendar embed for easy meeting scheduling.
User asks to add a dynamic token that inserts the prospect’s first name in every email body.
